q: `` Hopefully, I'll be with the Eagles next year. We'll see what happens,'' said Michael Vick , who added that he expects`` everything to go according to plan.'' We'll see what happens over the next couple months. I just got to be patient and take it day by day, he said. the collapse of such a dictatorship was`` inevitable'' in Egypt, as well as in other countries throughout the world.`` What comes next, it's hard to predict,'' Patrick Leahy said. A huge part of( Egypt's) natural product is tourism. They've got to get tourists feeling free to go back. Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now.`` The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued,`` because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere.'' Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt., had a similar response and called on the United States to support a transition to democracy.

They normally operated only 30 degrees off nadir, but the design requirement was for 60( essentially horizon-to-horizon coverage). Resolution beyond 30 degrees was lousy. by reflecting, praying.'' letter to supporters Thursday, Mike Pence said he and his family`` feel led to devote this time in our lives to continuing to serve the people of Indiana in some way.'' In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012, he said. Mike Pence is slated to speak at several county Republican dinners throughout the state and says he expects to also talk with people outside the political sphere as he makes his decision.
